faqs.question: What's the difference between mat and reformer Pilates?
faqs.answer: Mat Pilates uses body weight and small props on a mat. Reformer Pilates uses a specialized machine with springs for resistance. Both are effective - reformer offers more variety while mat is more portable.

faqs.question: Is Pilates good for back pain?
faqs.answer: Yes, Pilates is excellent for strengthening core muscles that support the spine. Many clients find relief from back pain. Always inform your instructor of any injuries or pain.

faqs.question: How is Pilates different from yoga?
faqs.answer: Pilates focuses more on core strength, controlled movements, and muscle toning. Yoga incorporates more stretching, balance, and mindfulness. Both complement each other well.

faqs.question: Can beginners do Pilates?
faqs.answer: Absolutely! Pilates is accessible for all fitness levels. Instructors teach foundational movements and progress at your pace. The controlled nature makes it safe for beginners.

faqs.question: How often should I do Pilates?
faqs.answer: 2-3 sessions per week is ideal for seeing results. Consistency matters more than frequency. Your instructor will recommend a schedule based on your goals.
